original_text: First results from RHIC on charged multiplicities, evolution of multiplicities with centrality, particle ratios and transverse momentum distributions in central and minimum bias collisions, are analyzed in a string model which includes hard collisions, collectivity in the initial state considered as string fusion, and rescattering of the produced secondaries. Multiplicities and their evolution with centrality are successfully reproduced. Transverse momentum distributions in the model show a larger pT-tail than experimental data, disagreement which grows with increasing centrality. Discrepancies with particle ratios appear and are examined comparing with previous features of the model at SPS.First results from RHIC on charged multiplicities, evolution of multiplicities with centrality, particle ratios and transverse momentum distributions in central and minimum bias collisions, are analyzed in a string model which includes hard collisions, collectivity in the initial state considered as string fusion, and rescattering of the produced secondaries. Multiplicities and their evolution with centrality are successfully reproduced. Transverse momentum distributions in the model show a larger pT-tail than experimental data, disagreement which grows with increasing centrality. Discrepancies with particle ratios appear and are examined comparing with previous features of the model at SPS.
original_translation: Los primeros resultados de RHIC sobre multiplicidades cargadas, la evolución de las multiplicidades con la centralidad, las razones de partículas y las distribuciones de momento transversal en colisiones centrales y de sesgo mínimo, se analizan en un modelo de cuerdas que incluye colisiones fuertes, colectividad en el estado inicial considerado como fusión de cuerdas y rescate de las secundarias producidas. Las multiplicidades y su evolución con la centralidad se reproducen con éxito. Las distribuciones de momento transversal en el modelo muestran una cola de pT más grande que los datos experimentales, una discrepancia que aumenta con la centralidad creciente. Aparecen discrepancias con las razones de partículas y se examinan comparando con características previas del modelo en SPS.
original_sentences: First results from RHIC on charged multiplicities, evolution of multiplicities with centrality, particle ratios and transverse momentum distributions in central and minimum bias collisions, are analyzed in a string model which includes hard collisions, collectivity in the initial state considered as string fusion, and rescattering of the produced secondaries.
Multiplicities and their evolution with centrality are successfully reproduced.
Transverse momentum distributions in the model show a larger pT-tail than experimental data, disagreement which grows with increasing centrality.

Discrepancies with particle ratios appear and are examined comparing with previous features of the model at SPS.First results from RHIC on charged multiplicities, evolution of multiplicities with centrality, particle ratios and transverse momentum distributions in central and minimum bias collisions, are analyzed in a string model which includes hard collisions, collectivity in the initial state considered as string fusion, and rescattering of the produced secondaries.
Multiplicities and their evolution with centrality are successfully reproduced.
Transverse momentum distributions in the model show a larger pT-tail than experimental data, disagreement which grows with increasing centrality.
Discrepancies with particle ratios appear and are examined comparing with previous features of the model at SPS.

Las multiplicidades y su evolución con la centralidad se reproducen con éxito.
Las distribuciones de momento transversal en el modelo muestran una cola de pT más grande que los datos experimentales, una discrepancia que aumenta con la centralidad creciente.
Aparecen discrepancias con las razones de partículas y se examinan comparando con características previas del modelo en SPS.

Los primeros resultados de RHIC sobre multiplicidades cargadas, la evolución de las multiplicidades con la centralidad, las razones de partículas y las distribuciones de momento transversal en colisiones centrales y de sesgo mínimo, se analizan en un modelo de cuerdas que incluye colisiones fuertes, colectividad en el estado inicial considerado como fusión de cuerdas y
rescate de las secundarias producidas
.
Aparecen discrepancias con las razones de partículas y se examinan comparando con características previas del modelo en SPS.
rescattering of the produced secondaries.translated_text:
Los primeros resultados de RHIC sobre multiplicidades cargadas, la evolución de las multiplicidades con la centralidad, las razones de partículas y las distribuciones de momento transversal en colisiones centrales y de sesgo mínimo, se analizan en un modelo de cuerdas que incluye colisiones fuertes, colectividad en el estado inicial considerado como fusión de cuerdas y
rescate de las secundarias producidas
. Las multiplicidades y su evolución con la centralidad se reproducen con éxito. Las distribuciones de momento transversal en el modelo muestran una cola de pT más grande que los datos experimentales, una discrepancia que aumenta con la centralidad creciente. Aparecen discrepancias con las razones de partículas y se examinan comparando con características previas del modelo en SPS.

original_annotated_sentences:
First results from RHIC on charged multiplicities, evolution of multiplicities with centrality, particle ratios and transverse momentum distributions in central and minimum bias collisions, are analyzed in a
string model
which includes hard collisions, collectivity in the initial state considered as string fusion, and rescattering of the produced secondaries.
Multiplicities and their evolution with centrality are successfully reproduced.
Transverse momentum distributions in the model show a larger pT-tail than experimental data, disagreement which grows with increasing centrality.

Discrepancies with particle ratios appear and are examined comparing with previous features of the model at SPS.First results from RHIC on charged multiplicities, evolution of multiplicities with centrality, particle ratios and transverse momentum distributions in central and minimum bias collisions, are analyzed in a
string model
which includes hard collisions, collectivity in the initial state considered as string fusion, and rescattering of the produced secondaries.
Multiplicities and their evolution with centrality are successfully reproduced.
Transverse momentum distributions in the model show a larger pT-tail than experimental data, disagreement which grows with increasing centrality.
Discrepancies with particle ratios appear and are examined comparing with previous features of the model at SPS.
